title: Rek'Sai Tip.
body: If the enemy team is trying to take drag, you can tunnel directly onto drag and surface inside of its hitbox, making it impossible for the enemy jungler to smite it if they have red or blue smite, since those smites prioritize champions over monsters.

replies.body: this... is very useful. thank you sir.

That's a scum strategy, really dirty. That's like people who play {{champion:120}} top and stand such that it's impossible to click on the cannon minion.

Sorry but I call it how I see it.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GFVVMZqz,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-09T10:05:38.573+0000)
>
> That's a scum strategy, really dirty. That's like people who play {{champion:120}} top and stand such that it's impossible to click on the cannon minion.
> 
> Sorry but I call it how I see it.

I just lost to it, so I'm definitely not endorsing it. However, it is something that is possible to do and people should know that it's doable imo. Why smite doesn't prioritize monsters is a mystery to me; I can think of very few situations where I would want to smite an enemy champ but a monster is blocking them. I can think of tons of examples of the reverse.
